title.narrative: Cuba Country Programming Framework for Inclusive and sustainable Industrial Development 2016 - 2020

description.narrative:
UNIDO is supporting Cuba’s efforts in investment and strategic alliance promotion endeavours for strengthening its industrial capabilities and competitiveness in priority industrial sectors – through the formulation of a Country Programme (CP) as requested by the Government, in line with the economic and industrial transformations decided by the Government and with the UNDAF signed for 2014-2018.
The Country Programme will focus on three main outcomes with an estimated amount of a total of EUR 42 million as agreed with Cuban authorities: a) Improvement of business environment and sustainability; b) Improvement of industrial competiveness. c) Attraction of foreign investment.
Government and donors support commitments for some components of the CP under formulation are currently under advanced negotiations: • USD 9.5 million from KOICA for Industrial policy formulation & implementation, Eco-industrial Park, Technological and Enterprise Upgrading Programmes (Approval from KOICA was communicated during DG’s mission to Korea in April 2015 and confirmed later by the PM-Vienna). • EUR 18 million from EU Commission and USD 0.9 million from GEF, for Renewable energies Programme (Official letters from Government in both cases are currently under preparation to be sent by MOFA to UNIDO; EU Delegation in Havana has expressed to Cuban counterparts their support for UNIDO involvement as implementing Agency; as indicated by the PM-Vienna and UNIDO consultant in Cuba).
Cuban government also considers matching the programme resources with Cuban own planned investment resources for prioritized sectors. It also takes into consideration the recent announcement of favourable change in relationship between USA and Cuba at the end of 2014 that may have a paramount impact on the industrial development and stakeholders in Cuba, including also the possibility of lifting the US economic embargo against Cuba in a near scenario.
A Preparatory Assistance to fine-tuning the CP interventions, including advanced negotiations with several interested donor (e.g. Kuwait) has been requested during a meeting of UNIDO DG with Cuban Permanent Mission Representative last 11th May 2015. It is expected to have the final CP version to be signed and officially launched during a DG’s mission to the country in November 2015.
